re-elicitPhoneNumber: I'm sorry. Please tell me the policy holder's phone number again.
re-elicitPhoneNumber1: I didn't follow. Please tell me the policy holder's phone number
Dob: OK. For verification, please tell me the date of birth of this policy holder.
PhoneNumberConfirmation1: <speak>That was <say-as interpret-as='digits'>{phone_number}</say-as>. Correct? Please say either 'yes' or 'no'. </speak>
re-elicitPhoneNumber2: I didn't find a match. Please say or enter the policy holder's phone number again.
FirstName: OK. What's the first name of the new driver you want to add to your policy?
Confirmation: OK. Adding a driver to your policy will result in premium increase. Your new estimated monthly premium would be, $231. The change will be effective from today, {today}. Can I go ahead and add the driver?
MaritalStatus: Thanks. What is the marital status of the new driver?
Relationship: And what is the driver's relationship with the policy holder? For example, you can say something like, spouse, child, co-owner, employee, or others.
re-elicitMaritalStatus: Sorry I didn't get that. For marital status of the driver, you can say one of these, married, single, divorced, separated, widowed.
re-elicitLicenseNumber: I am sorry. Please tell me the driver's license number again.
re-elicitLicenseNumber1: I didn't follow. Please tell me the driver's license number.
LicenceConfirmation1: <speak>That is <say-as interpret-as='characters'>{license_number}</say-as> . Correct? Please say either 'yes' or 'no'.</speak>
Fulfilment: Done. New driver has been added to your policy, and your premium has been updated accordingly. We will send you an email with the confirmation. Is there anything else I can help you with?
Failure: I am sorry. I'm not able to add a new driver to your policy at the moment. Let me connect you to a representative who can help.
Denied: Okay then. I will not proceed. What else can I do for you?
